So, who is ready to make some science?

PROS: The game takes everything that made the previous title good and ran with it.  The puzzles are more challenging and the gameplay is just as tight.  This time, however, they mix things up with new mechanics.  The different gels add a new aspect to the puzzles, along with hard light bridges, excursion funnels, and more to spice up different chambers.  The sequences in the middle of the game vary the entire feel of the level design and visual flair in the abandoned labs, and the soundtrack kicks in at appropriate moments.  The co-op is also a welcome addition, providing challenging puzzles that require four portals working together, providing a real sense of accomplishment for completing each.  Finally, the voice acting is once again top notch, providing more dark humor to giggle along with.  Ellen McLain returns in her role as GLaDOS, but Steven Merchant excels as the dim-witted Wheatley, but J.K. Simmons steals the show as Cave Johnson.

CONS: Some of the puzzles in the abandoned labs can feel more like just hunting for a single wall to hit a successful portal onto, and the white gel puzzles can be a little bland to set things up.  Besides that, the customization for co-op is practically an afterthought.

ACHIEVEMENTS: These can drag on a little, as some of the tasks, especially the co-op ones, require timing and precision on both players parts.  Amusingly enough, though, the truly difficult one is the achievement requiring you to play the tutorial co-op level with a friend after you've completed the co-op campaign.  This means finding another player who has not played the co-op yet, or just cheesing it with two accounts and a second copy of the game.

FINAL: Portal 2 is an overall improvement over the first title, with larger levels, broader puzzles, a heftier story, and co-op challenges that feel well designed, and not tacked on.  Where it isn't the smash hit or as easily completed as the original, it still stands on it's own with everything it has to offer.

Drôle, Indémodable, Culte, ce deuxième volet des aventures de Chell est un bijou auquel tout gamer doit jouer au moins une fois dans sa vie, et ce malgré son age qui commence à montrer le bout de ses dents!
Ce jeu de logique vous fait incarner Chell, une sujette de tests dans le complexe scientifique d'Aperture Science, dans un futur apocalyptique. Grâce aux "portails" (des trous de ver, vous permettant de passer instantanément d'un endroit à un autre au sein d'une salle de test), vous, Chell, et un Robot se prénommant Wheatly tenterez de vous échapper de ce complexe décrépit, en y découvrant au passage de terribles secrets sur le passé d'Aperture.
Le Jeu offre une histoire courte (une dizaine d'heures, environ), le tout dans une voix cynique et armé d'humour caustique, grâce auxquelles il fait une critique des multinationales modernes, et de la "american way of life".
À découvrir!
